variant.name: DualThread
variant.summary: Dual thread rendering mode. This mode is active when an AudioWorklet is connected to the audio graph. Rendering callbacks are done on both AudioDeviceThread and AudioWorkletThread.

variant.name: SingleThread
variant.summary: Single thread rendering mode. This mode is used when no AudioWorklet is connected to the audio graph. Rendering callbacks are executed solely on the AudioDevice thread.

variant.name: .Intervals
variant.summary: Streams ran for more than 1 interval (1000 callbacks)

variant.name: .Short
variant.summary: Streams ran for less than 1000 callbacks

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.Length
histogram.summary: The length (in frames) requested by createBuffer(). Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.NumberOfChannels
histogram.summary: The number of channels requested by createBuffer(). Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.SampleRate384kHz
histogram.summary: The sample rate (in Hz) requested by createBuffer(). Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.SampleRateRatio384kHz
histogram.summary: The ratio of the buffer sample rate from createBuffer() to the context sample rate. This indicates if the buffer needs to be resampled. Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContext.CreateTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to create the AudioContext object. This is recorded every time an AudioContext is successfully created.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContext.HardwareSampleRate
histogram.summary: The hardware sample rate (in Hz) used by an AudioContext. Recorded for every WebAudio AudioContext that is created; probably only one or two per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContext.latencyHintCategory
histogram.summary: If provided, the latencyHint option category of "interactive", "balanced", "playback", or "exact", in that order where "exact" means an explicit floating point value was provided. Recorded for every AudioContext that is constructed with a latencyHint.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContext.latencyHintMilliSeconds
histogram.summary: If the latencyHint is provided and is a floating-point number, the value in milliseconds is recorded. This is recorded for every AudioContext that is constructed with a floating-point latencyHint value.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContext.MaxChannelsAvailable
histogram.summary: The maximum number of (hardware) channels available in an AudioContext. Recorded for every WebAudio AudioContext that is created; probably only one or two per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContext.MediaPlaybackWhileNotVisible.InterruptionType
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason for the AudioContext being interrupted when the frame is being controlled by the MediaPlaybackWhileNotVisible permission policy and the frame is not visible.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContext.Operation
histogram.summary: Tracks occurences of AudioContext operations, to allow assessing what proportion of AudioContexts are explicitly closed.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContextOptions.sampleRate
histogram.summary: The sample rate requested by developer to be used as the sample rate when constructing an AudioContext with an AudioContextOptions dictionary. This is recorded for each AudioContext created, probably just one or two per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioContextOptions.sampleRateRatio
histogram.summary: The ratio of the user-selected sample rate to the hardware sample rate of an AudioContext. The ratio is represented as a percentage. This is recorded for each AudioContext created, probably just one or two per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.CallbackBufferSize
histogram.summary: The callback buffer size (in audio frames) for WebAudio rendering between the WebAudio graph and the audio device thread. This can differ from the value recommended by the audio hardware due to internal constraints in WebAudio. Recorded for every WebAudio AudioContext that is created.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.HardwareBufferSize
histogram.summary: The buffer size (in audio frames) for WebAudio rendering recommended by the audio hardware. Recorded for every WebAudio AudioContext that is created.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.HardwareOutputLatency
histogram.summary: The latency reported from the audio hardware. This number can be dynamic at runtime but the metric is collected only once at the first platform audio callback after an AudioContext is created.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.OutputDeviceStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of the selected audio output device at the time a sink is created. This helps understand the reliability and availability of output devices.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.{ModeTag}.FIFODelay{LatencyTag}
histogram.summary: The audio delay in milliseconds based on the number of available frames of the PushPUllFIFO in AudioDestination. The metric is averaged and reported at every 1000 render callbacks. This metric is categorized by "ModeTag", which indicates the rendering mode: DualThread, used when audio worklet is involved. Or SingleThread, used when audio worklet is not involved.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.{ModeTag}.FIFOUnderrunCount{Duration}{LatencyTag}
histogram.summary: The number of times the PushPullFIFO in AudioDestination experienced an underrun. The "Intervals" duration indicates that the metric is measured and logged every 1000 audio render callbacks. For "Short", it is logged at the end of the audio stream. This metric is categorized by "ModeTag", which indicates the rendering mode: DualThread, used when audio worklet is involved. Or SingleThread, used when audio worklet is not involved.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.{ModeTag}.RenderTimeRatio{LatencyTag}
histogram.summary: The percentage of time spent in AudioDestination::Render relative to the expected callback interval.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.{ModeTag}.RequestRenderGapTimeRatio{LatencyTag}
histogram.summary: The percentage of time elapsed between a request to AudioDestination::RequestRender and its actual start, relative to the expected callback interval.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.{ModeTag}.RequestRenderTimeRatio{LatencyTag}
histogram.summary: The percentage of time spent in AudioDestination::RequestRender relative to the expected callback interval.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioDestination.{ModeTag}.TotalPlayoutDelay{LatencyTag}
histogram.summary: The audio delay in milliseconds that covers the whole pipeline from the WebAudio graph to the speaker. This metric is categorized by "ModeTag", which indicates the rendering mode: DualThread, used when audio worklet is involved. Or SingleThread, used when audio worklet is not involved. The metric is averaged and reported at every 1000 render callbacks.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioWorklet.PeakDedicatedBackingThreadCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of dedicated backing worklet threads throughout the lifetime of the document/frame.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioWorklet.PeakSharedBackingThreadRefCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of ref counts using the shared backing thread throughout the lifetime of the document/frame.

histogram.name: WebAudio.Autoplay
histogram.summary: The autoplay status of an AudioContext when destroyed. This include all types of frames. In order to know the value only for main frames, the .CrossOrigin values can be substracted.

histogram.name: WebAudio.Autoplay.CrossOrigin
histogram.summary: The autoplay status of an AudioContext when destroyed in a cross-origin frame.

histogram.name: WebAudio.Autoplay.UnlockType
histogram.summary: Records how an AudioContext was unlocked (if it was). This is recorded when the AudioContext is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebAudio.BiquadFilter.Type
histogram.summary: The type of the BiquadFilterNode. Recorded each time the type is set. This recorded once (to lowpass) when a biquad filter is created and also recorded whenever the filter type changes due to user action or programatically. It is unlikely the type will change more than once.

histogram.name: WebAudio.ConvolverNode.ImpulseResponseLength
histogram.summary: The duration in millisec of impulse responses for a ConvolverNode. Recorded each time the impulse response is set for a ConvolverNode.

histogram.name: WebAudio.IIRFilterNode.Order
histogram.summary: The order of the WebAudio IIRFilterNode. The order is one less than the number of feedback coefficients used in the denominator of the IIRFilter transfer function. Recorded each time an IIRFilter is constructed.

histogram.name: WebAudio.OfflineAudioContext.CreateTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to create the OfflineAudioContext object. This is recorded every time an OfflineAudioContext is successfully created.

histogram.name: WebAudio.PannerNode.PanningModel
histogram.summary: The panning model for the PannerNode. Recorded once with the default value at creation and once again whenver it is changed. Once changed, it is unlikely to be changed again. If there are any PannerNodes created at all, then there is probably one for each source (AudioBufferSourceNode, OscillatorNode, or other source).

histogram.name: WebAudio.PushPullFIFO.UnderflowGlitches
histogram.summary: Captures if WebAudio caused glitches or not due to the FIFO underflow. It is recorded when PushPullFIFO is destroyed. (e.g. navigating away from the page.)

histogram.name: WebAudio.PushPullFIFO.UnderflowPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of FIFO underflow happened due to the the missed deadline of WebAudio rendering engine. It is recorded when PushPullFIFO is destroyed. (e.g. navigating away from the page.)
